CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 9, 1960, pg. 4, reads: "Robberies - Murder Scene - This 'blind' area in the 2100 block of Elmore Sq., has been the scene of four taxicab robberies and assaults since October. Clarence Hicks, Owl driver, was robbed and stabbed at spot shown by arrow on far left in October. Two weeks later, a Yellow Cab driver was robbed and beaten in same spot. On New Year's morning at 3:30 o'clock, People's Cab driver Bernard Oliver Sr. was found, with his head battered in a $40 robbery, at the spot shown by center arrow. Two hours later, William H. Allen was found in a parking area at the side of the adjacent building shown by right arrow. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Street and parking area with one car, site of robberies and murder, 2100 block of Elmore Street in Terrace Village, Hill District
